de.dfki.lt.hfc

Class Operator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dfki.lt.hfc.Operator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AggregationalOperator, FunctionalOperator, RelationalOperator

    public abstract class Operator
extends java.lang.Object
    NOTE: since some of the below operators modify global data structures (usually from the tuple store) and since such operators are used in rules which are applied in parallel, it is extremely IMPORTANT to lock, i.e., to SYNCHRONIZE such structure, making them a ``critical section'' (as Java calls it) !!!
    Since:
    JDK 1.5
    See Also:
    FunctionalOperator, AggregationalOperator

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected TupleStore tupleStore
      access (and modification) to the tuple store by FO is only allowed by the below methods, calling (potentially synchronized) methods from the tuple store

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Operator() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Set<int[]> ask() 
      boolean ask(int[] tuple)
      checks whether a ground tuple (i.e., a tuple wo/ vars) exists in the tuple store
      java.util.Set<int[]> ask(int pos, int obj)
      obtains all those tuples which contain an object obj (represented as an int) at a specific position pos in a tuple (an int);
      java.lang.String getExternalRepresentation(int id)
      calls getObject() from class TupleStore
      int getId(java.lang.String literal)
      returns the id for a given literal (e.g., a string encoding a URI, blank node, XSD int, XSD string, etc.);
      AnyType getObject(int id)
      calls getJavaObject() from class TupleStore; calling this.tupleStore.getJavaObject(...) inside a FO can thus be reduced to getObject(...)
      int getProxy(int uri)
      returns the proxy (the representative) for a given uri which serves as the internal name for a URI or a blank node
      int getRelation(int uri)
      returns the equivalence relation for uri
      int registerObject(java.lang.String string, AnyType object)
      calls registerJavaObject() from class TupleStore; calling this.tupleStore.registerJavaObject(...) inside a FO can thus be reduced to registerObject(...); we make sure that the modification of the data structures is synchronized!
      void setProxy(int left, int right)
      calls addEquivalentElements() for the int representation of two individuals; we make sure that the modification of the data structures is synchronized!
      void setRelation(int uri, int rel)
      make an association between an internal uri and the internal representation of the equivalence relation; we make sure that the modification of the data structures is synchronized!

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getObject

        public AnyType getObject(int id)
        calls getJavaObject() from class TupleStore; calling this.tupleStore.getJavaObject(...) inside a FO can thus be reduced to getObject(...)

      • getExternalRepresentation

        public java.lang.String getExternalRepresentation(int id)
        calls getObject() from class TupleStore

      • getId

        public int getId(java.lang.String literal)
        returns the id for a given literal (e.g., a string encoding a URI, blank node, XSD int, XSD string, etc.);
        Returns:
        a positive int iff there exists a mapping in the tuple store between the literal and this int

      • getProxy

        public int getProxy(int uri)
        returns the proxy (the representative) for a given uri which serves as the internal name for a URI or a blank node

      • setProxy

        public void setProxy(int left,
            int right)
        calls addEquivalentElements() for the int representation of two individuals; we make sure that the modification of the data structures is synchronized!

      • getRelation

        public int getRelation(int uri)
        returns the equivalence relation for uri

      • setRelation

        public void setRelation(int uri,
               int rel)
        make an association between an internal uri and the internal representation of the equivalence relation; we make sure that the modification of the data structures is synchronized!

      • registerObject

        public int registerObject(java.lang.String string,
                 AnyType object)
        calls registerJavaObject() from class TupleStore; calling this.tupleStore.registerJavaObject(...) inside a FO can thus be reduced to registerObject(...); we make sure that the modification of the data structures is synchronized!

      • ask

        public boolean ask(int[] tuple)
        checks whether a ground tuple (i.e., a tuple wo/ vars) exists in the tuple store

      • ask

        public java.util.Set<int[]> ask(int pos,
                       int obj)
        obtains all those tuples which contain an object obj (represented as an int) at a specific position pos in a tuple (an int);
        Returns:
        a set of matching tuples which have obj at position pos or the empty set if there are no tuples matching the constraints

      • ask

        public java.util.Set<int[]> ask()
        Returns:
        the set of all tuples
